intro: Babingtonia cherticola, commonly known as the yellow babingtonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Babingtonia cherticola is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas with mild climates.
